title: Issue 339
summary: MAUI Preview 13 and VSMac - Let's gooo!

items.description:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #339 of Weekly Xamarin - a snapshot of what's been happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities over the last week.

Some great releases this week with MAUI Preview 13 coming out and also a new VS Mac release. Good things to keep you busy for the weekend.

Have a great one,

Kym
items.description_markdown:
G'day everyone, welcome to issue #339 of Weekly Xamarin - a snapshot of what's been happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities over the last week.

Some great releases this week with MAUI Preview 13 coming out and also a new VS Mac release. Good things to keep you busy for the weekend.

Have a great one,

Kym

items.title: Implement Folder Picker with .NET MAUI, WinUI and macOS
items.description:
In this post Gerald show us how to implement a folder picker with .NET MAUI by using dependency injection and implementing platform code.

items.description_markdown:
In this post Gerald show us how to implement a folder picker with .NET MAUI by using dependency injection and implementing platform code.

items.title: Release Your .NET MAUI iOS App to the Apple App Store
items.description:
Hooray! You have your .NET MAUI iOS app ready, and want to publish it to the Apple App Store. In this video I will walk you through ALL THE STEPS (there is a lot…) needed to generate a signed .NET MAUI iOS IPA file that can be sent to the App Store, ready for publishing! In addition to showing you how to do this from Visual Studio 2022, I will also tell you how you can do it from your automated build pipeline.

Release Your .NET MAUI iOS App to the Apple App Store by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Hooray! You have your .NET MAUI iOS app ready, and want to publish it to the Apple App Store. In this video I will walk you through ALL THE STEPS (there is a lot…) needed to generate a signed .NET MAUI iOS IPA file that can be sent to the App Store, ready for publishing! In addition to showing you how to do this from Visual Studio 2022, I will also tell you how you can do it from your automated build pipeline.

[**Release Your .NET MAUI iOS App to the Apple App Store**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kpZi5xAvpZA) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **Release Your .NET MAUI iOS App to the Apple App Store**

items.title: Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 13
items.description:
The 13th preview of .NET Multi-platform App UI is now available in Visual Studio 17.2 Preview 1. In addition to quality improvements, this release includes several implementations such as Label.FormattedText as we close in on feature complete for the upcoming release.

Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 13 by David Ortinau
items.description_markdown:
The 13th preview of .NET Multi-platform App UI is now available in Visual Studio 17.2 Preview 1. In addition to quality improvements, this release includes several implementations such as Label.FormattedText as we close in on feature complete for the upcoming release.

[**Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 13**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/announcing-net-maui-preview-13/) by [David Ortinau](https://twitter.com/davidortinau)

items.title: Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 6
items.description:
Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 6 is now available; this release focuses on addressing top issues from Preview 5 release as well as continuing the move of the IDE to native macOS UI.

Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 6 by Jordan Matthiesen
items.description_markdown:
Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 6 is now available; this release focuses on addressing top issues from Preview 5 release as well as continuing the move of the IDE to native macOS UI.

[**Visual Studio 2022 for Mac Preview 6**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/visual-studio-2022-for-mac-preview-6/) by [Jordan Matthiesen](https://twitter.com/jmatthiesen)
